jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Why Auctor

Auctor is building the AI layer for professional services and software implementation. Think of us as the brain behind the best solution engineers, forward-deployed engineers, and onboarding teams— automating the documentation, the discovery, and the decision-making that powers $400B+ in services work. We’re going after one of the biggest software categories of the decade, and the market is wide open. Some reasons to join Auctor are:

  • Strategic investors: Raised over Seed and Series A from top-tier funds and angels.

  • Performance: 70%+ MoM ARR growth since founding.

  • Competitive compensation.

Role Overview

As a Product Designer at Auctor, you’ll shepherd multiple projects from concept to launch. You’ll craft high-caliber designs, interactions, and prototypes that turn complex problems into seamless solutions. Partnering closely across all teams at Auctor, you’ll weave AI into experiences that help users understand, trust, and steer AI outputs.

We seek someone with sharp interaction instincts, refined visual taste, and a collaborative spirit— someone who obsesses over details, invites feedback, and uplifts ideas through tight cross-functional teamwork.

What You’ll Do

  • Drive end-to-end product experiences, taking ideas from spark to polished release.

  • Work hand-in-hand with engineers, and AI researchers to convert business goals into user-centered designs.

  • Evolve and maintain our design system, ensuring a unified, scalable visual language.

  • Run user research to surface pain points and opportunities, feeding insights back into design choices.

  • Build prototypes that explore and validate new features, flows, and interactions.

  • Uphold a high design bar, steering the team toward thoughtful, deliberate decisions at every turn.

What You Have

  • Experience crafting products in fast-moving settings, backed by a portfolio showcasing your strongest work.

  • A knack for unraveling complex challenges and distilling them into clear, intuitive experiences.

  • Deep experience with design systems and a keen eye for visual and interaction craft.

  • A track record of user research and applying those findings to design.

  • Top-notch communication and storytelling skills to convey design ideas and reasoning.

Compensation Range

$150,00-$220,000

Benefits

  • Early-stage equity

  • Competitive, top-of-market salary

  • Catered lunch and dinners

jobs.title: Software Engineering Intern
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Why Auctor

Auctor is building the AI layer for professional-services and software-implementation work—the “brain” behind the best solution engineers, forward-deployed engineers, and onboarding teams. We automate the discovery, documentation, and decision-making that drives $400B+ in services every year. The category is massive and still wide-open. Some reasons to join Auctor:

  • Rocket-ship trajectory: 70 %+ MoM ARR growth since day 1.

  • World-class backing: Raised Seed & Series A from top-tier funds and angels.

  • Impact at startup speed: Ship production code, not slide decks.

  • Mentorship that matters: Work elbow-to-elbow with founders who’ve done this before.

Internship Overview

Join us in New York City for 10–12 weeks and help build the next generation of AI-powered workflow tools. You’ll pair with engineers on projects that ship to real customers—no toy tasks or shadow assignments.

What You’ll Do

  • Contribute features to our Next.js + Python stack, from API to UI

  • Prototype and benchmark LLM-powered agentic workflows

  • Build retrieval pipelines over large, messy enterprise datasets

  • Write clean, well-tested code and see it hit production the same week

  • Demo your work directly to customers and the leadership team

What We’re Looking For

  • Solid programming foundations (data structures, algorithms, networking basics)

  • Proficiency in Python and TypeScript (or a strong desire to learn)

  • Curiosity about LLMs, vector databases, and scalable infra

  • A bias for action—hack first, polish second, always deliver

  • Ability to work on-site in NYC at least 5 days/week (we’re in-person, fast, and collaborative)

Compensation

$55.00 per hour

Perks & Benefits

  • Early-stage equity for returning interns / full-time offers

  • Catered lunch and dinners

  • Housing provided

jobs.title: Founding Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Why Auctor

Auctor is building the AI layer for professional services and software implementation. Think of us as the brain behind the best solution engineers, forward-deployed engineers, and onboarding teams— automating the documentation, the discovery, and the decision-making that powers $400B+ in services work. We’re going after one of the biggest software categories of the decade, and the market is wide open. Some reasons to join Auctor are:

  • World-class team: The best talent from Apple, Meta, Tesla, and more.

  • Strategic investors: Raised Seed and Series A from the best funds and angels in the world.

  • Performance: 70%+ MoM ARR growth since founding.

  • Competitive compensation.

Role Overview

As a founding engineer at Auctor, you will own and lead engineering projects across our software offerings. You will work closely with our operations, GTM, and deployed services teams to build state-of-the-art systems that provide value to our customers.

We’re looking for people who want to do the most meaningful work of their career—people who are sharp, fast, and relentless. No fluff. Just speed, execution, and a shot to build something generational.

This role is based in New York, NY, in person 6 days per week.

What You’ll Do

  • Design and implement enterprise-level application interfaces

  • Develop complex performant agentic workflows

  • Architect full-stack infrastructure for high-performance applications

  • Retrieve over large corpora of unstructured enterprise data

  • Evaluate LLMs across various application layer use-cases

What You Have

  • Strong programming skills and general Computer Science knowledge

  • Proficiency in Python and TypeScript (Next.js experience preferred)

  • Customer obsession and a knack for developing highly-intuitive products

  • Demonstration of grit and tenacity— previous startup experience is valued

Compensation Range

$175,000-$290,000

Benefits

  • Early-stage equity

  • Competitive, top-of-market salary

  • Catered lunch and dinners
